title: Sally Soames, Fleet Street photographer celebrated for her revealing black and white portraits of the famous – obituary
text:
Sally Soames, who has died aged 82, was a Fleet Street photographer who covered everything from the Yom Kippur war to National Front demonstrations, but her real strength was portraiture; she had the gift of establishing a personal connection with her subjects, and her images – always shot in black and white and mostly in natural light – seemed to capture the inner spirit of her sitters, revealing the vulnerable individual behind the public face.
